trial_identification.studytitle: A Randomised Controlled Trial of a running program for Hospital Neurological Outpatients
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The impact of dynamic training (running program) on high level functional mobility in individuals with acquired brain injury - A randomised controlled trial in Neurologcial outpatients clinic

interventions.interventions: This is a randomised controlled trial of a high level mobility exercise program run by physiotherapists for 8 weeks with one session per week for approximately 2 hrs. The focus is on dynamic movements. It is sometimes called a running program although some participants can not run.
interventions.comparator: Standard Neurological Physiotherapy Outpatient rehabilitation. - 1-2 sessions of 1 - 2 hrs per week for 8 weeks following randomisation. The focus is the facilitate normal control and function of the affected trunk and limbs.

primaryOutcome.outcome: High level Mobility scale (HiMat) is the primary outcome.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: All participants will be assessed prior to baseline to be able to stratify the population on mobility performance and also basic balance and safety. So this is the baseline stratification period the week before entry into the study. Then post intervention will be performed at 8 weeks.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Chedoke McMaster Stroke Assessment -II 6MWT - six minute walk test , 10MWT - 10m walk test Community Integration questionnaire
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At the start (baseline) and finish (8 weeks)of the intervention period.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Acquired brain Injury admitted to Royal Perth Hosiptal neurologcial outpatients Berg Balance scale - Screening will be conducted by a Senior Neurological Physiotherapist
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: The senior physiotherapist in the outpatient clincial will assess all candidates for safety to participate. If they have poor balance or cognitive function they will not be considered for inclusion. Physical concomitant problems impacting on mobility (i.e. amputation, crainiectomy etc) are also exclsion criteria.

trial_design.sequence: Stratified (Functional mobility and balance performance), Concealled block randomisation with computer generated permutations.
